intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium camkorijense subsp. sarykamyschense, commonly known as the Sarykamysh hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its composite flower heads and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
